body:
Since I've been having troubles with `libvirt-coreos` installation, I've digged a bit and found out that the permissions inside Kubernetes tarballs changed between 0.16.0 and 0.17.0. I've downloaded both tarballs, extracted them into separate directories and then extracted the Kubernetes server tarballs. This is what I get:

```
$ ls -la 0.16.0/ 0.17.0/
0.16.0/:
insgesamt 90852
drwxrwxr-x 3 npr npr     4096 Jun 10 15:04 .
drwxrwxr-x 6 npr npr     4096 Jun 10 15:00 ..
drwxr-xr-x 7 npr npr     4096 Apr 29 07:07 kubernetes
-rw-rw-r-- 1 npr npr 93013717 Apr 29 08:03 kubernetes.tar.gz

0.17.0/:
insgesamt 93100
drwxrwxr-x 3 npr npr     4096 Jun 10 15:00 .
drwxrwxr-x 6 npr npr     4096 Jun 10 15:00 ..
drwxr-x--- 7 npr npr     4096 Mai 12 06:48 kubernetes
-rw-rw-r-- 1 npr npr 95314980 Mai 13 02:04 kubernetes.tar.gz

$ ls -lad 0.16.0/kubernetes 0.17.0/kubernetes
drwxr-xr-x 7 npr npr 4096 Apr 29 07:07 0.16.0/kubernetes
drwxr-x--- 7 npr npr 4096 Mai 12 06:48 0.17.0/kubernetes

$ ls -lad 0.16.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes 0.17.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes
drwxr-xr-x 3 npr npr 4096 Apr 29 07:07 0.16.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes
drwxr-x--- 3 npr npr 4096 Mai 12 06:48 0.17.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes

$ ls -lad 0.16.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/ 0.17.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/
drwxr-xr-x 2 npr npr 4096 Apr 29 07:07 0.16.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/
drwxr-x--- 2 npr npr 4096 Mai 12 06:48 0.17.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/

$ ls -la 0.16.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/ 0.17.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/
0.16.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/:
insgesamt 277588
drwxr-xr-x 2 npr npr     4096 Apr 29 07:07 .
drwxr-xr-x 3 npr npr     4096 Apr 29 07:07 ..
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 35351696 Apr 29 07:07 hyperkube
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 28470544 Apr 29 07:07 kube-apiserver
-rw-r--r-- 1 npr npr       33 Apr 29 07:07 kube-apiserver.docker_tag
-rw-r--r-- 1 npr npr 31147520 Apr 29 07:07 kube-apiserver.tar
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 22532576 Apr 29 07:07 kube-controller-manager
-rw-r--r-- 1 npr npr       33 Apr 29 07:07 kube-controller-manager.docker_tag
-rw-r--r-- 1 npr npr 25209856 Apr 29 07:07 kube-controller-manager.tar
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 19709432 Apr 29 07:07 kubectl
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 29435800 Apr 29 07:07 kubelet
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 17458200 Apr 29 07:07 kube-proxy
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 36957008 Apr 29 07:07 kubernetes
-rwxr-xr-x 1 npr npr 17629768 Apr 29 07:07 kube-scheduler
-rw-r--r-- 1 npr npr       33 Apr 29 07:07 kube-scheduler.docker_tag
-rw-r--r-- 1 npr npr 20306944 Apr 29 07:07 kube-scheduler.tar

0.17.0/kubernetes/server/kubernetes/server/bin/:
insgesamt 285300
drwxr-x--- 2 npr npr     4096 Mai 12 06:48 .
drwxr-x--- 3 npr npr     4096 Mai 12 06:48 ..
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 37285888 Mai 12 06:48 hyperkube
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 29016240 Mai 12 06:48 kube-apiserver
-rw-r----- 1 npr npr       33 Mai 12 06:48 kube-apiserver.docker_tag
-rw-r----- 1 npr npr 31690240 Mai 12 06:48 kube-apiserver.tar
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 23046128 Mai 12 06:48 kube-controller-manager
-rw-r----- 1 npr npr       33 Mai 12 06:48 kube-controller-manager.docker_tag
-rw-r----- 1 npr npr 25719808 Mai 12 06:48 kube-controller-manager.tar
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 20077224 Mai 12 06:48 kubectl
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 30563960 Mai 12 06:48 kubelet
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 17768744 Mai 12 06:48 kube-proxy
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 38343360 Mai 12 06:48 kubernetes
-rwxr-x--- 1 npr npr 17959552 Mai 12 06:48 kube-scheduler
-rw-r----- 1 npr npr       33 Mai 12 06:48 kube-scheduler.docker_tag
-rw-r----- 1 npr npr 20633600 Mai 12 06:48 kube-scheduler.tar
```

I suppose, there has been a concious decision to restrict the world's access to those binaries. However, this breaks the `libvirt-coreos` installation routine mentioned above and probably makes life a bit more difficult in several other places.

I'd be thankful for a correction if this wasn't intended or a pointer to the appropriate commit it this is legit -- I'd correct the `libvirt-coreos` installation.

labels.description: Lowest priority. Possibly useful, but not yet enough support to actually get it done.
labels.name: priority/awaiting-more-evidence

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Cluster Lifecycle.
labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle

title: kubernetes directory in release tarballs is not world-readable
